metadata.title: CVE-2022-35260 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: curl can be told to parse a `.netrc` file for credentials. If that fileendsin a line with 4095 consecutive non-white space letters and no newline,curlwould first read past the end of the stack-based buffer, and if thereadworks, write a zero byte beyond its boundary.This will in most casescause a segfault or similar, but circumstances might also cause differentoutcomes.If a malicious user can provide a custom netrc file to anapplication or otherwise affect its contents, this flaw could be used asdenial-of-service.

criterions.comment: curl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
